metadata.synopsis: The avatar talks to Nightsong in camp after meeting Lorroakan and seeing how he is looking for her. The player explains what he knows, which will trigger nightsong to leave to camp to confront Lorroakan.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1- Recruit NS 3- Debugbook -> Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong wait for dialog at camp2- Talk to nightsong in camp

60.speaker: Nightsong
60.text: Mother's Milk - your visage speaks of ill tidings. Speak, ally mine: what troubles you?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: A wizard called Lorroakan is looking for you.

23.speaker: Nightsong
23.text: Is he indeed? Pray tell, what does he seek from Dame Aylin?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I think he just wants to talk. We should go find out what he wants.

20.speaker: Nightsong
20.text: Aylin, I'm not sure about this. Something doesn't feel right.

51.speaker: Isobel
51.text: Aylin, I'm not sure about this. Something doesn't feel right.

37.speaker: Nightsong
37.text: Your intuitions are my lodestar, darling. But consider: now that Dame Aylin has returned to the fold of time, she could use allies and interlocutors.

10.speaker: Isobel
10.text: I'll come with you, then. Just in case.

43.speaker: Nightsong
43.text: My darling, we agreed you'd scout for the nearest Selûnite enclave this very night. Let us divide our efforts, all the sooner to be reunited.

30.speaker: Isobel
30.text: I won't let you go alone. Who knows what this wizard might have planned?

16.speaker: Nightsong
16.text: Our closest ally will accompany me - won't you? It will be a swift and fruitful chore.

2.speaker: Nightsong
2.text: Hmm. If you judge him worth the endeavour, then I will do as you say. Now that Dame Aylin has returned to the fold of time, she will need allies and interlocutors.

33.speaker: Nightsong
33.text: Hie we to this 'Lorroakan' right away. I am as eager to meet him as he is to ensnare me.

31.text: Do not speak false to Dame Aylin. Not after all we have endured.

19.speaker: Nightsong
19.text: Do not speak false to Dame Aylin. Not after all we have endured.

53.speaker: Nightsong
53.text: I must face the villain, nose-to-nose and sword-to-sword. I hope I can count on your aid in the fight to come.

0.speaker: Isobel
0.text: You can't go alone. I'm coming too.

21.speaker: Nightsong
21.text: Dame Aylin will make short work of this wizard - whatever his intentions.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: He wants to cage you like Ketheric did.
13.context: NodeContext: spits it out with disgust

46.speaker: Isobel
46.context: NodeContext: spits it out with disgust

44.speaker: Nightsong
44.text: Oh, I hope he tries. Please, Lorroakan, come to me with your magicks and your flaccid charms. Attempt to lay one hairy finger upon Dame Aylin, daughter of Selûne most high.
44.context: NodeContext: Low fury, daring Lorroakan to try to capture and cage her.

38.speaker: Nightsong
38.text: I will wring his neck until he's dead.

55.speaker: Nightsong
55.text: Ho! His end will be one more strand in the great braid of our friendship.

45.speaker: Isobel
45.text: I'm coming with you. I'd like to get a few licks in myself.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I deceived him into thinking you're dead.

6.speaker: Nightsong
6.text: The weasel out-weasled. Well done, my friend.

42.speaker: Nightsong
42.text: But Dame Aylin's deeds are great; her presence - present. Sooner or later, he will discover that the daughter of Selûne lives.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Don't pursue him, Aylin. He's dangerous.

34.speaker: Nightsong
34.text: It is he who must not pursue me.

24.speaker: Nightsong
24.text: Let us travel to his chambers, his lair. We will see him undone in the style of the dead, unburied Ketheric Thorm.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Don't pursue him, Aylin. He could be dangerous.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: All I know is that he's put out a contract for your capture.

26.speaker: Nightsong
26.text: Magicians and their machinations. I have had enough for an eternity.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: He seemed a braggart and a fool - I wouldn't worry about it.

11.speaker: Nightsong
11.text: Dame Aylin does not worry; she strategises.

7.speaker: Nightsong
7.text: If this wizard, by your estimation, is a bungling buffoon, it may be best to let him tie himself in knots.

15.speaker: Nightsong
15.text: Then again... it may be best to tie the knot myself.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: He seems dangerous. I think we ought to put an end to him.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: He put a bounty out for your capture and now there is a violent mercenary looking for you.

9.speaker: Nightsong
9.text: Let them come, and let them find me. Dame Aylin will strike down any who seek to bring her to harm's home.

35.speaker: Nightsong
35.text: Yet... it is better to cut off the head of the snake than to let its slithering snakelings swarm us unabated. This wizard... this wizard must be held to account.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: A wizard called Lorroakan was looking to capture you - I went ahead and killed him.

39.speaker: Nightsong
39.text: Ha! Ally mine, you continue to delight.

1.speaker: Nightsong
1.text: I will pray anew to my Moon Mother for your health, wealth, and happiness.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I was just wondering what it was like in that cage of Balthazar's.

12.speaker: Nightsong
12.text: Let us not dwell on those dark days. Their memory is a vortex within my heart that leads directly to the Hells.

54.speaker: Nightsong
54.text: Troubles make a poor supper. Do not hesitate to spit yours out.
